Package Presentation

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • Presentation.Controller
  • public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    The Controller class acts as an intermediary between the View and the business logic. It handles user actions from the View and interacts with the corresponding business logic classes.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Controller()
      Initializes the Controller by creating instances of the business logic classes and the View.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addClient​(int id, java.lang.String name, java.lang.String address, java.lang.String email, int age)
      Adds a new client with the given details.
      void addProduct​(int id, java.lang.String name, int price, int quantity)
      Adds a new product with the given details.
      void createOrder​(int selectedClient, int selectedProduct, int quantity)
      Creates a new order with the selected client, product, and quantity.
      void deleteClient​(int id)
      Deletes a client with the specified ID.
      void deleteProduct​(int id)
      Deletes a product with the specified ID.
      void editClient​(int id, java.lang.String name, java.lang.String address, java.lang.String email, int age)
      Updates the details of an existing client.
      void editProduct​(int id, java.lang.String name, int price)
      Updates the details of an existing product.
      int generateID()
      Generates a unique order ID.
      void getAllClients()
      Retrieves all clients from the database and displays them in the View.
      void getAllOrders()
      Retrieves all orders from the database and displays them in the View.
      void getAllProducts()
      Retrieves all products from the database and displays them in the View.
